alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 03 at 10:28PM AKST until December 05 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION HEAVY SNOW EVENT FOR THE HIGHWAYS... .A gale force low will move into the Gulf of Alaska Monday. The associated front will track north, bringing the panhandle preciptiation. The northerly winds in Northern Lynn Canal are expected to keep the cooler air in place, so when the precip collides with the cooler air, moderate to heavy snow will result over a 24 hour period. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO NOON AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches. * WHERE...Klondike Highway, Haines Highway, and Klukwan. * WHEN...From noon Monday to noon AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult and is discouraged unless it is an emergency. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will begin Monday morning. For Haines and the Haines Highway, heavy snow is expected Monday afternoon with snowfall rates near 1 inch per hour. Snowfall rates will lighten Monday evening before heavier snow moves back in Monday night into Tuesday morning. For the Klondike Highway, moderate snowfall is expected Monday afternoon with heavy snow moving in late Monday night into Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. Heavy wet snow will be difficult to manage due to high water content. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
